value.name: Harvesting wild foods in forest preserves is a crime, officials warn: ‘What draws our attention is when we see people carrying bags full’
value.description: As the popularity of wild foods grows, foraging on public lands is ramping up. But if harvesting is taking place in forest preserves, it is a crime. The penalties can be stiff, ranging from a minimum of $25 to a $225 fine.
